00043 void KMuonVetoSystemRecord::CopyLocalMembers(const KMuonVetoSystemRecord &aRec)
00044 {
00045         
00046         fRunNumber = aRec.fRunNumber;
00047         fMultiADC = aRec.fMultiADC;  
00048         fDistanceEst = aRec.fDistanceEst; 
00049         fDistanceNemo = aRec.fDistanceNemo; 
00050         fEventNumber = aRec.fEventNumber;  
00051         fFileNumber = aRec.fFileNumber;  
00052         fMultiTDC = aRec.fMultiTDC; 
00053         fPcTimeSec = aRec.fPcTimeSec;
00054         fPcTimeMuSec = aRec.fPcTimeMuSec;
00055         fCommonStopTime = aRec.fCommonStopTime;
00056         fEventQuality = aRec.fEventQuality;
00057         fEventQuality.Compact();
00058

00068 void KMuonVetoSystemRecord::Clear(Option_t *opt)
00069 {
00070   //Clear the base classes and then clear/delete any local
00071   //members. Its necessary for this Clear method to exist
00072   //in the case that instances of this object are stored
00073   //inside of a TClonesArray
00074   //Also, if this class holds any TClonesArrays, it must call
00075   //TClonesArray::Clear("C")
00076         KSystemRecord::Clear(opt);
00077         
00078   //Clear and delete local objects here. 
00079 
00080   //Re initialize local members here and prepare for the next use of this class.
00081   InitializeMembers();
00082 
00083 }
00084 
00085 void KMuonVetoSystemRecord::InitializeMembers(void)
00086 {
00087         //Initialize local members
00088         
00089   //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS
00090   //ONLY SET MEMBERS ON THE STACK TO THEIR INITIAL VALUES
00091         
00092         SetMultiADC(-99);
00093         SetDistanceEst(-99.0);
00094         SetDistanceNemo(-99.0);
00095         SetEventNumber(0);
00096         SetFileNumber(-99);
00097         SetMultiTDC(-99);
00098         SetPcTimeSec(-99);
00099         SetPcTimeMuSec(-99);
00100         SetRunNumber(-99);
00101         SetCommonStopTime(-99);
00102         fEventQuality.Clear();
00103 }
00104 
00105 Bool_t KMuonVetoSystemRecord::IsTimeReconstructed(void) const
00106 {
00107         //This checks a hard-coded run number, kReconstructedTimeRunBoundary = 60
00108         //and compares it to the GetRunNumber. If the Muon Veto System run is less
00109         //than 60, then it returns true, meaning that the stamp time of the Muon
00110         //veto system events were reconstructed. Otherwise it returns false. 
00111         
00112         return (GetRunNumber() > kReconstructedTimeRunBoundary) ? true : false;
00113 }
00114 
00115 void KMuonVetoSystemRecord::SetEventQualityBits(TBits *aBits)
00116 {
00117         fEventQuality = *aBits;
00118         fEventQuality.Compact();
00119 }

00121 Bool_t KMuonVetoSystemRecord::IsSame(const KMuonVetoSystemRecord &aRec, Bool_t bPrint) const
00122 {
00123         //Compares two objects and their member variables to test for equality.
00124         //If bPrint is set to true, then a message for each member variable that is different
00125         //will print to standard out. Otherwise, this method will return false and quit
00126         //checking member variables as soon as it finds a unequal data member.
00127         
00128         Bool_t bIsEqual = true; //assume its true, then test for differences
00129         
00130         //call the base class's IsSame methods
00131         if(!this->KSystemRecord::IsSame(aRec,bPrint)){
00132                 bIsEqual = false;
00133                 if(!bPrint)
00134                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00135                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00136         }
00137         
00138         if(fRunNumber != aRec.fRunNumber){
00139                 bIsEqual = false;
00140                 if (bPrint) 
00141                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fRunNumber Not Equal. lhs: " 
00142                         << fRunNumber << " != rhs " << aRec.fRunNumber << endl;         
00143                 else
00144                         return false;  
00145         }
00146 
00147         
00148         if(fMultiADC != aRec.fMultiADC){
00149                 bIsEqual = false;
00150                 if (bPrint) 
00151                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fMultiADC Not Equal. lhs: " 
00152                         << fMultiADC << " != rhs " << aRec.fMultiADC << endl;           
00153                 else
00154                         return false;  
00155         }
00156         
00157         if(fDistanceEst != aRec.fDistanceEst){
00158                 bIsEqual = false;
00159                 if (bPrint) 
00160                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fDistanceEst Not Equal. lhs: " 
00161                         << fDistanceEst << " != rhs " << aRec.fDistanceEst << endl;     
00162                 else
00163                         return false;  
00164         }
00165         
00166         if(fDistanceNemo != aRec.fDistanceNemo){
00167                 bIsEqual = false;
00168                 if (bPrint) 
00169                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fDistanceNemo Not Equal. lhs: " 
00170                         << fDistanceNemo << " != rhs " << aRec.fDistanceNemo << endl;           
00171                 else
00172                         return false;  
00173         }
00174         
00175         if(fEventNumber != aRec.fEventNumber){
00176                 bIsEqual = false;
00177                 if (bPrint) 
00178                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fEventNumber Not Equal. lhs: " 
00179                         << fEventNumber << " != rhs " << aRec.fEventNumber << endl;             
00180                 else
00181                         return false;  
00182         }
00183         
00184         if(fFileNumber != aRec.fFileNumber){
00185                 bIsEqual = false;
00186                 if (bPrint) 
00187                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fFileNumber Not Equal. lhs: " 
00188                         << fFileNumber << " != rhs " << aRec.fFileNumber << endl;       
00189                 else
00190                         return false;  
00191         }
00192         
00193         if(fMultiTDC != aRec.fMultiTDC){
00194                 bIsEqual = false;
00195                 if (bPrint) 
00196                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fMultiTDC Not Equal. lhs: " 
00197                         << fMultiTDC << " != rhs " << aRec.fMultiTDC << endl;           
00198                 else
00199                         return false;  
00200         }
00201         
00202         if(fPcTimeSec != aRec.fPcTimeSec){
00203                 bIsEqual = false;
00204                 if (bPrint) 
00205                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fPcTimeSec Not Equal. lhs: " 
00206                         << fPcTimeSec << " != rhs " << aRec.fPcTimeSec << endl; 
00207                 else
00208                         return false;  
00209         }
00210         
00211         if(fPcTimeMuSec != aRec.fPcTimeMuSec){
00212                 bIsEqual = false;
00213                 if (bPrint) 
00214                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fPcTimeMuSec Not Equal. lhs: " 
00215                         << fPcTimeMuSec << " != rhs " << aRec.fPcTimeMuSec << endl;             
00216                 else
00217                         return false;  
00218         }

00225                 else
00226                         return false;  
00227         }

00230                 bIsEqual = false;
00231                 if (bPrint) 
00232                         cout << "KMuonVetoSystemRecord fEventQuality Not Equal" << endl;                
00233                 else
00234                         return false;  
00235         }
00236

00240 void KMuonVetoSystemRecord::Compact(void)
00241 {
00242         //make the event class as small as possible. this calls 'Compact' for all member
00243         //variables that are KDS classes, member variables that can be compacted (such as TBits)
00244         //and base classes
00245         
00246         KSystemRecord::Compact();
00247         
00248         fEventQuality.Compact();
00249 }
00250  
00251 Bool_t KMuonVetoSystemRecord::TestEventQualityBit(Int_t i) const
00252 {
00253         /*
00254          These bits are set by the Neider processing, which provides some event quality 
00255          information. From the TTree::Draw/Scan methods, the array of UChar_t which hold these
00256          bits can be accessed from the variable fMuonSystem.fEventQuality.fAllBits[].  
00257          
00258          One can test these bits in the TTree Draw/Scan methods via the bit-wise operators &, |.
00259          For example
00260          
00261          t->Draw("fAdc[][0]","fMuonSystem.fEventQuality.fAllBits & 0x1") 
00262          
00263          would draw the zeroth ADC value for only events where there was a 'reliable stamp'. 
00264          
00265          0: reliable stamp
00266          1: corrected stamp (jump)
00267          2: stamp available
00268          3: stamp is pctime
00269          4: ADC mismatches in this event
00270          5: Multi is not the same as in binaries
00271          6: *NO* TDC End of Buffer found!
00272          7: TDC afterpulse
00273          8: ADC afterpulse (should never happen)
00274          9: no TDC Data available
00275          
00276          
00277          12: adc header found after noTDCEOB
00278         */
00279         return fEventQuality.TestBitNumber(i);
00280 
00281 }
